page.title: 04The Bible College
page.content: The Bible College, which belongs to the Assemblies of God, is sited in Mattersey Hall which stands on the eastern edge of the village. The oldest section of the Hall is 400 years old and is used by the students as a laundry area. The panelled dining room, built after 1918 by Sir Stuart Goodwin is now a lecture room. the Hall itself has changed from being a private residence, a boys Prep School and finally in 1973 the Bible College. It houses approximately 70 students from all over the world. Their fees are paid by the Assemblies of God Churches and other donations. At the present time two new blocks are being built. This will mean an increase in the number of residential students. Some married students with familites stay in rented accommodation in the surrounding district.
